name: LES Skatepark
description: Official concrete skatepark under the Manhattan Bridge. A well-designed mix of street and transition elements that serves as one of Manhattan's primary skateparks.
history: Built in 2012 by NYC Parks Department with significant input from the local skate community. Filled a long-standing need for a proper skatepark on the Lower East Side. Quickly became one of the city's top parks and a daily destination for Manhattan skaters.
bestTimes: Early mornings (before 10am) for fewer crowds. Weekday sessions are the most mellow. Weekend afternoons are packed. Avoid right after school lets out.
transitDirections: F to East Broadway (walk north toward the bridge). B/D to Grand St (walk south). The park is in Coleman Playground, directly under the Manhattan Bridge.

detailedNotes.terrain: Concrete throughout. The bowl section has pool coping and decent depth. Street section features ledges, flat bars, a stair set, and quarter pipes. Good flow between areas.
detailedNotes.culture: Diverse crowd â€” from sponsored ams to weekend warriors. Respectful lineup etiquette is expected in the bowl. Strong local crew.
detailedNotes.warnings: Gets extremely crowded on nice-weather weekends. Scooter kids can be an issue. The area under the bridge provides some rain cover but the park is essentially outdoor.
